resources.string: Test your knowledge of this simple, infinitely complex game and find out why it is the oldest game in the world still played in its original form.
1. When did the oldest recorded game of Go occur?
2. What country did the game start in?
3. …and what is the name of Go in that country today?
4. What are the dimensions of a full sized Go board?
5. How many points are there on a board?
6. It is estimated that there are this many different possible board postions:
7. Who played the infamous \'Ear Reddening Move\' against Gennan Inseki in 1846?
8. What is the name of the first computer program to beat the best Go player in the world?
9. Finish the quote: "Go is to Chess…"
10. Would you like to learn more about how to play Go?
Learn the basics and play some Go here: http://playgo.to/iwtg/en/
